text: Raw signal intensities for each probe set were extracted from CEL files using RMA using R/Bioconductor (

version 2.13.2, released on 09/30/2011), and the affy package. MAS5.0 was used to assign P(resent) calls indicating reliable gene detection. ID_REF =  VALUE = Data are raw RMA signal intensities. These intensities are log(2) transformed values of the original hybridization signals.

protocol.text: The rpl24b mutant allele stv1-1 (Nishimura et al. Plant Cell 17: 2940-2953 (2005) in the Wassiliweskijia (Ws) ecotype was grown alongside wild type Arabidopsis thaliana. Three biological replicates were grown at different times.

Seedlings were grown on agar plates containing full strength Murashige and Skoog salts, pH 5.7, and 1% sucrose for 10-12 days in a 16h light 8h dark cycle at 22oC. Fluorescent light intensity was 80micromole/m2/sec.

Aerial parts of seedlings were harvested 6h into the light period. Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions. Polysomal and nonpolysomal/monosomal RNAs were isolated using sucrose density gradients according to Kim et al. Genome Biology 8:R60 (2007).
Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol.
Following fragmentation, cRNA were hybridized to Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Arrays.
